boat.name: Constance
boat.full_description:
Constance was launched on 8 July 2006 in the River Colne at Rowhedge, Essex. She had been built by Fabian Bush's yard, just across the river. Visit the photo gallery of her building, launch and sailing on the Albert Strange Association website.

Clinker larch on oak frames, wych elm and iroko centreline, she has a sheathed ply deck, oak coaming and trim, solid spruce spars and a roller reefing jib. She has a high-peaked lug main and gunter mizzen wiht sails in tan clipper by Steve Hall, North Sea Sails.

Constance is slim and easily driven and her Honda 2.3 quarter-mounting outboard give 5kts flat out. She sleeps two very good friends.
boat.construction_details: Larch clinker on wych elm and oak
boat.short_description: Based on Albert Strange design #45, Wenda of 1899, Constance is a 25 ft. canoe yawl with standing lug main, gunter mizzen and tan sails by Steve Hall, North Sea Sails.
